abstract: New York City agrees to pay total of $322,500 to six Occupy Wall Street protesters who say they were unjustly pepper-sprayed by Deputy Inspector Anthony Bologna, while peacefully corralled behind police netting, in September 2011.
lead_paragraph: The New York City Law Department said the latest settlements, totaling $332,500, were in the city’s best interest.

headline.main: New York City Settles With 6 Occupy Wall Street Protesters Pepper-Sprayed by the Police
headline.print_headline: City Settles With Six Occupy Protesters Pepper-Sprayed by the Police

snippet: The New York City Law Department said the latest settlements, totaling $332,500, were in the city’s best interest.
